intro: Fimbristylis reunionis, commonly known as the Reunion sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the island of Réunion in the Indian Ocean and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and establish in suitable habitats. Fimbristylis reunionis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
